mdRecord.dcterms:title: The Southern opinion's Prize poems
Prize poems
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Pollard, H. Rives. [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Prize poem to the Confederate dead (Unanimously awarded by the Committee of the Hollywood Memorial Association, to whom were referred all poems on this subject.) Twilight at Hollywood / I.R. (i.e. Innis Randolph) -- Prize poem in laudation of the deeds, valour, sufferings and sacrifices of the Confederate soldiers. (Awarded to Paul H. Hayne, Esq., of South Carolina, by the Committee to whom were referred all poems on this subject) [Untitled] -- Prospectus of the newspaper, The Southern opinion, by H. Rives Pollard, Editor and proprietor
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: Inscr. "Coln. T.J. Randolph." Gift of Miss Olivia Taylor to the Tracy W. McGregor Library. [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Hollywood Cemetery (Richmond, Va.)--Poetry
Southern opinion (Richmond, Va.)
